testCases.explanation: 3 appears 2 times out of 3. 2/3 > 1/3, so 3 is a majority element. 2 appears once, not more than n/3.
Single element: 1 appears 1 time out of 1. 1/1 > 1/3, so it qualifies.
Both 1 and 2 appear once out of 2 elements. 1/2 > 1/3, so both qualify. At most 2 elements can appear more than n/3 times.
3 appears 3 times out of 5 (3/5 > 1/3). 2 appears 2 times out of 5 (2/5 > 1/3). Both qualify.
0 appears 3 times out of 3. 3/3 > 1/3, so 0 is the only majority element.

description: Given an integer array of size n, find all elements that appear more than n/3 times. Return all such elements in any order. There can be at most two such elements.
